65a25bb7-d272-46ee-8134-a9611369ab75.description: The Strategy & Account Planning Bootcamp is a 12-week intensive professional development program led by current industry strategy, account planning, and creative professionals. issuer.summary: issued by Miami Ad School Toronto

badge_template_activities.title: Modules: An Overview Research: Qualitative & Quantitative, Understanding Your Client's Problem, Measuring Impact through Data, Developing Insights, Brief Writing, Customer Experience, Connections/Communications Planning, Pitching New Business.
Portfolio Sessions: A series of portfolio guidance classes, finalized by presenting a final portfolio to the program director in addition to visiting strategists from across the globe.
Pitching and Presenting: A series of sessions where students get the chance to apply their learnings by presenting solutions to the challenges set in their main module class and receive feedback.

Live Client Project: A month-long project pitch for a live client, in a team alongside an art director, copywriter, and social media strategist. Students are responsible for incorporating all of the learnings from the Bootcamp to create a fully integrated campaign from scratch. Students need to showcase their work from research, to brief creation, creative campaign, and pitch skills in front of a series of mentors and the final client. This is a competition format.

Toolbox Sessions: A bonus session outside of the fundamental learning objectives of the Bootcamp that involve relevant and helpful skills to acquire, platform demonstrations, or other unique learning opportunities.

badge_template_activities.title: Deep dive into a UX project over 16 weeks in an agency like environment. Starting with research and discovery, into Ideation, Prototyping and Designing, and Finally Testing & Refining. While learning Students will hone their Design thinking & presentation skills, wrapping up with some portfolio building sessions.

Students learn how to best way to showcase themselves as designers, and the process of a UX project. Also included is resume review and what employers are looking for to prepare participants for the interview that could launch their career.

Over the 16 weeks students will have to chance to learn how to build decks and present UX work along the various stages of the process. They will gain confidence in describing and explaining their work, demonstrate their point of view, and provide a rationale for design decisions.

Some Skills Covered: Research Methodologies, Personas & Customer Journey Mapping, Ideation & Sketching Techniques, Accessibility, Design Systems, User Flows, Wireframing, Prototyping and Collaboration software (Miro + Figma), User Testing Methodologies and more.
Work with real clients in an agency like setting. Students work on and deliver projects to real live clients & walk away with two projects overseen by industry experts for their UX Design portfolio.
